forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 17 to 31 mph, with gusts as high as 55 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a shroud of gray clouds and a persistent drizzle paint the landscape, offering a calm yet somber rhythm to the day. Rain is imminent, saturating the air with a cool, crisp scent. With temperatures hovering around the mid-fifties, the nature of the day feels more introspective than invigorating. Winds from the south-southeast whistle through the streets, occasionally gusting in a spirited dance, reminding us that the city’s character is as fluid as the weather. The iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge stands dimly against the bleak backdrop, a testament to endurance amidst nature's whims.

As the rain intensifies this evening, temperatures will rise slightly, a curious paradox that may blanket the city in a thick marine layer. This fog may well snuggle into the nooks of the vibrant city, softening the outlines of familiar landmarks. Given these conditions, a waterproof jacket paired with a cozy sweater would be prudent, enhancing comfort as you traverse the slick sidewalks. Today, consider indulging in the cozy comfort of a chic café, perhaps with a window seat where you can watch the raindrops race down the glass, or lose yourself in a novel at your favorite library—activities that cradle the spirit while savoring the day’s quietude.
